titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Richard Harison Papers
1730-1920
MS 279
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:42 -0400.

did.abstract:
Correspondence, deeds, accounts, surveys, legal papers, mortgages, indentures, titles, wills, estate inventories, articles of agreement, statements, legal opinions, contracts, and maps related to Harison and other members of his family. Much of his correspondence and other papers pertain to his extensive land holdings, claims against the British Army for billeting and timber, his partnership with Robert Troup from 1791, the settlement of the estate of George Folliott, his activities as U.S. attorney for the district of New York, settlement of the affairs between Robert Bird and Jacob Smith, and many legal cases concern marine insurance and settlement of estates, family matters, and his own estate.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Richard Harison papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.
